Class Card_State

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Model.Cards.Utils_Cards.Card_State
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbandonedShipState, AbandonedStationState, combat_fixing_state, CombatZoneState, EpidemicState, meteor_fixing_state, MeteorCardState, OpenSpaceState, pirates_fixing_state, PiratesState, PlanetState, SlaversState, SmugglersState
public abstract class Card_State extends Object implements Serializable

  • Field Details

    • card

      protected Card card
      Represents a specific card that serves as the current state within the game. This variable holds a reference to a card object and plays a central role in managing the game state.

  • Constructor Details

    • Card_State

      public Card_State()

  • Method Details

    • getNextState

      public Card_State getNextState() throws Exception
      Retrieves the next state of the current card.
      Returns:
      the next state of the card, which in this implementation, returns the current state itself.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the state transition.

    • activate

      public void activate(ArrayList<Player> players, ArrayList<Integer> indices, FlightBoard flightBoard)
      Activates a specific behavior or state based on the current game context.
      Parameters:
      players - the list of players participating in the game
      indices - the list of indices relevant to the activation logic
      flightBoard - the current state of the flight board in the game

    • Activate

      public void Activate(ArrayList<Player> p, ArrayList<Integer> c, FlightBoard flightBoard)
      Activates a specific card state within the context of the flight board and players.
      Parameters:
      p - the list of players involved in the activation process
      c - the list of integers representing specific contextual data for activation
      flightBoard - the flight board on which the activation is applied

    • Activate

      public void Activate(ArrayList<Goods> goods) throws Exception
      Activates a process involving the provided list of goods.
      Parameters:
      goods - the list of goods to be processed during activation
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during activation

    • Activate

      public void Activate(FlightBoard fb) throws Exception
      Activates the specified flight board.
      Parameters:
      fb - the flight board to be activated
      Throws:
      Exception - if the activation process is not supported or fails

    • activate

      public void activate(FlightBoard flightBoard) throws Exception
      Activates the current state of the card using the provided flight board.
      Parameters:
      flightBoard - the FlightBoard object used during the activation process
      Throws:
      Exception - if the activation is not supported or cannot be performed

    • chooseCannonBatteryPos

      public void chooseCannonBatteryPos(FlightBoard flightBoard, Player player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> cannonPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos) throws Exception
      Allows a player to choose positions for cannon and battery placements on their flight board. This method ensures the action is performed only during the player's turn.
      Parameters:
      flightBoard - the flight board associated with the current game session
      player - the player who is performing the action
      cannonPos - a list of positions selected for placing cannons
      batteriesPos - a list of positions selected for placing batteries
      Throws:
      Exception - if the action is attempted outside of the player's turn

    • goNextState

      public void goNextState()
      Advances the current state of the card in the state management process. The specific implementation of this transition is not yet supported and will throw a runtime exception when invoked. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses or implemented as part of the card state transition logic.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - always, as the current implementation does not support transitioning to the next state.

    • goNextState

      public void goNextState(Player player) throws Exception
      Transitions the current state of the card to the next state for the given player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player for whom the state transition is being performed
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the state transition

    • chooseHowToFaceMeteors

      public void chooseHowToFaceMeteors(Player player, ArrayList<Integer> howToDefenceFromShots, FlightBoard flightBoard) throws Exception
      Allows the player to determine how to defend against approaching meteors using available defenses.
      Parameters:
      player - The player making the decision on how to face the meteors.
      howToDefenceFromShots - A list representing options or strategies for defending against meteor shots.
      flightBoard - The current state of the flight board, which may influence the decision-making process.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the execution of this method.

    • acceptToLandOnAPlanet

      public void acceptToLandOnAPlanet(Player p, boolean yOn, int NumPlanet) throws Exception
      Handles the action of a player deciding whether to land on a specific planet.
      Parameters:
      p - The player attempting to land on the planet.
      yOn - A boolean indicating the player's agreement or decision to land.
      NumPlanet - The identifier of the planet the player is attempting to land on.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the operation cannot be completed, such as when it is not the player's turn.

    • chooseToClaimReward

      public void chooseToClaimReward(FlightBoard flightBoard, boolean yOn, Player player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> storageTiles, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> newGoods) throws Exception
      Allows the player to decide whether to claim a reward during the game. This method interacts with the player's current game state and the game board to manage the decision-making process.
      Parameters:
      flightBoard - The current flight board of the game, representing the central game state.
      yOn - A boolean indicating the player's choice or condition for claiming the reward.
      player - The player making the decision to claim the reward.
      storageTiles - A 2D list representing storage tile positions or states that may influence the process.
      newGoods - A 2D list representing the new goods being introduced or transferred during this action.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the action cannot be completed or causes an unexpected game state error.

    • chooseToClaimReward

      public void chooseToClaimReward(boolean yOn, Player player) throws Exception
      Handles the process where a player chooses to claim a reward. Verifies if it is the player's turn before allowing the action.
      Parameters:
      yOn - a boolean indicating whether the reward claim option is enabled or not for the player.
      player - the player attempting to claim the reward.
      Throws:
      Exception - if it is not the player's turn or any other issue occurs during the operation.

    • chooseWhereToPutGoods

      public void chooseWhereToPutGoods(Player player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> posGoods, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> goodsSets) throws Exception
      Handles the logic for allowing a player to choose where to place goods on the game board.
      Parameters:
      player - The player making the decision about where to place the goods.
      posGoods - A list of positions where goods can be placed, represented as indices.
      goodsSets - A list of sets of goods available for placement.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an invalid action is attempted or the player is not allowed to take a turn.

    • chooseAbandonedStation

      public void chooseAbandonedStation(Player player, FlightBoard flightBoard, boolean yOn, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> storageTiles, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> newGoods) throws Exception
      Allows the player to choose an abandoned station. This method involves updating the player's game state and interacting with the flight board and other provided game data.
      Parameters:
      player - The player making the choice.
      flightBoard - The flight board for the current game where the action takes place.
      yOn - A boolean flag that may indicate a specific game condition or choice.
      storageTiles - A nested list representing storage tile positions or configurations.
      newGoods - A nested list of goods that may be associated with the abandoned station choice.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the action is invalid or cannot be completed due to game rules.

    • chooseToStartFirePower

      public void chooseToStartFirePower(Player p, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> DoubFireTriplets, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> BatteriesToAct) throws Exception
      Allows the player to initiate firepower actions during the game. This includes handling the provided cannon batteries and activating certain components for firing.
      Parameters:
      p - The Player object representing the player who is performing the action.
      DoubFireTriplets - An ArrayList containing lists of integers which represent triplets indicating double firepower configurations.
      BatteriesToAct - An ArrayList containing lists of integers which represent positions of batteries that need to be activated for firing.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the action cannot be performed due to game state constraints or invalid input.

    • chooseToStartMotor

      public void chooseToStartMotor(Player player, FlightBoard flightBoard, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> enginesPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos) throws Exception
      Allows a player to choose actions for starting their motor based on the given positions of engines and batteries.
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to start the motor.
      flightBoard - The flight board associated with the player's ship.
      enginesPos - A list of positions for the engines that can be used by the player.
      batteriesPos - A list of positions for the batteries that can be used by the player.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the action cannot be performed, such as when it is not the player's turn.

    • chooseToPlaceBatteries

      public void chooseToPlaceBatteries(Player p, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> posBatAndNumBattXPos) throws Exception
      Allows a player to choose the positions to place batteries on the flight board.
      Parameters:
      p - The player making the selection.
      posBatAndNumBattXPos - A 2D list where each inner list contains battery positions and the number of batteries per position.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the action is not allowed or an error occurs related to game state.

    • choosePassengersToLose

      public void choosePassengersToLose(Player p, boolean yOn, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> pass) throws Exception
      Handles the process in which a player chooses passengers to lose.
      Parameters:
      p - The player making the selection.
      yOn - A boolean indicating if a specific condition is active during the selection process.
      pass - A list of lists where each inner list represents groups of passengers on the player's ship.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the action is attempted when it is not the player's turn or if any other error occurs during the process.

    • Continue

      public void Continue(FlightBoard fb) throws Exception
      This method continues the current state or operation within the provided flight board context. Specific behavior and implementation are yet to be defined.
      Parameters:
      fb - the FlightBoard passed as the context for this action
      Throws:
      Exception - if the operation cannot be performed

    • chooseOneSubShip

      public void chooseOneSubShip(int index, int playerID) throws Exception
      This method allows a player to select a specific sub-ship based on an index. If the action is attempted out of turn, an exception is thrown using the event bus.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the sub-ship to be selected
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player attempting the selection
      Throws:
      Exception - if the player attempts the action out of turn or any other error occurs
